AccessType_ReadWrite.description: Specifies the type of access that the organization has.

Code_OSI.description: A proprietary code used between systems to identify an Other Service Information (OSI) item.

Code_Passenger.description: Passenger type code containing 3 alpha characters as defined by ATPCO.

Code_SSR.description: Special Service Request code containing 4 letters as defined by IATA

Country_Code_ISO3166.description: Specifies a 2 character country code as defined in ISO3166.

Currency_Code_ISO4217.description: An ISO 4217 (3) alpha character code that specifies a monetary unit.

FlightType.description: Specifies a particular type of flight (e.g. direct, stopover).

NameType.description:
OTA Code list: Name Type	NAM	
	1	Former
	2	Nickname
	3	Alternate
	4	Maiden

Percent.description: A decimal number that indicated percentage.

SeatDirection.description: Identifies the orientation of a seat relative to the direction of  travel.

StateProv_Code.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

Telephone_Extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number

Telephone_AreaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

Telephone_CountryAccessCode.description: Used for Numeric Strings length 1 to 3.

TicketType.description: Specifies the type of ticket document (e.g. electronic, paper).

Address_BldgRoom.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

buldingInd.description: When true, the information is a building name.

streetNmbrSuffix.description: Usually a letter right after the street number (A in 66-A, B in 123-B etc).

streetDirection.description: Street direction of an address (e.g., N, E, S, NW, SW).

ruralRouteNmbr.description: Numerical equivalent of a rural township as defined within a given area (e.g., 12, 99).

pO_Box.description: Defines a Post Office Box number.

currencyCode.description: Specifies the currency code for the amount.

decimalPlaces.description: Implementer: The ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" is typically used when the amount provided includes the minor unit of currency without a decimal point (e.g., USD 8500 needs DecimalPla

Cabin_Air.description: Specifies the cabin type (e.g. first, business, economy).

Cabin_Air_Base.description: Specifies the cabin type (e.g. first, business, economy).

MemberIdentifier.description: Identifier assigned to person registered with travel club.

Date_EffectiveExpire.description: Used to identify the effective date and/or expiration date.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

division.description: The division name or ID with which the contact is associated.

department.description: The department name or ID with which the contact is associated.

shortName.description: Used to provide the company common name.

code.description: Identifies a company by the company code.

codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

name.description: The name or code of a country (e.g. as used in an address or to specify citizenship of a traveller).

Country_Name.description: The name or code of a country (e.g. as used in an address or to specify citizenship of a traveller).

Currency_Code.description: An ISO 4217 (3) alpha character code that specifies a monetary unit.

DecimalPlaces.description: The ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" is typically used when the amount provided includes the minor unit of currency without a decimal point (e.g., USD 8500 needs DecimalPlaces="2" to represent $85).

currencyCode.description: An ISO 4217 (3) alpha character code that specifies a monetary unit.

decimalPlaces.description: Implementer: The ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" is typically used when the amount provided includes the minor unit of currency without a decimal point (e.g., USD 8500 needs DecimalPlaces="2" to represent $85).

creatorID.description: ID of creator. The creator could be a software system identifier or an identifier of an employee resposible for the creation.

lastModifierID.description: Identifies the last software system or person to modify a record.

purge.description: Date an item will be purged from a database (e.g., from a live database to an archive).

Date_EffectiveExpire.description: Used to identify the effective date and/or expiration date.

expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, indicates that the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

Email.description: Electronic email addresses, in IETF specified format.

emailType.description: Defines the purpose of the e-mail address (e.g. personal, business, listserve). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Email Address Type (EAT).

remark.description: A remark associated with the e-mail address.

shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

validInd.description: If true, this is a valid email address that has been system verified via a successful email transmission.

defaultInd.description: If true, this identifies this is the default email address.

Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

PasswordHint.description: Alternate method to password for account access.

answer.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

question.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

type.description: Type of name of the individual, such as former, nickname, alternate or alias name. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Name Type (NAM).

language.description: The language the name is represented in, e.g. an Eastern name versus a Western name.

Surname.description:
Family name, last name. 
Note: Simple form of person name should be used for the full name.
May also be used for full name if the sending system does not have the ability to separate a full name into its parts, e.g. the surname element may be used to pass the full name.

Person_Document.description: Document  information for verification purposes and also used for additional filtering for common names.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

defaultInd.description: If true, this is the default or primary name within a collection of names.

Price.description: Specifies price after all applicable taxes of a product such as the rate for a room or fare for a flight.

amountBeforeTax.description: The price before taxes are applied.

currencyCode.description: The currency code for the amount.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

shareMarketInd.description: Permission for sharing data for marketing purposes.

shareSyncInd.description: Permission for sharing data for synchronization of information held by other travel service providers.

optInStatus.description: If present and set to opt out, a customer has explicitly opted out of marketing communication. When set to opt out it overrides the ShareMarketInd.

optInDate.description: The date and time of opt in.

optOutDate.description: The date and time of opt out.

brandName.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

chainName.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

PropertyCode.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

hotelName.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

ReservationId.description: Contains the reservation (resId) or cancellation number for the reservation.

type.description: Specifies the type of reservation ID (e.g. reservation number, cancellation number).

source.description: Specifies a unique identifier to indicate the source system which generated the resId.

sourceContext.description: Specifies the context of the source.

StateProv.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

name.description: State, province, or region name or code needed to identify location.

StateProv_Name.description: State, province, or region name or code needed to identify location.

stateCode.description: The standard code or abbreviation for the state, province, or region.

Telephone_Simple.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

countryAccessCode.description: Code assigned by telecommunications authorities for international country access identifier.

areaCityCode.description: Code assigned for telephones in a specific region, city, or area.

phoneNumber.description: Telephone number assigned to a single location.

extension.description: Extension to reach a specific party at the phone number.

id.description: Used elsewhere in the message to reference a specific telephone number (including faxes).

TelephoneDetail.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

pIN.description: Additional codes used for pager or telephone access rights.

remark.description: A remark associated with the telephone number.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

PhoneLocationType.description: Describes the location of the phone, such as Home, Office, Property Reservation Office, etc.

PhoneTechType.description: Indicates type of technology associated with this telephone number, such as Voice, Data, Fax, Pager, Mobile, TTY, etc.

PhoneUseType.description: Describes the type of telephone number, in the context of its general use (e.g. Home, Business, Emergency Contact, Travel Arranger, Day, Evening). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Phone Use Type (PUT).

defaultInd.description: When true, indicates a default value should be used.

Text_Free.description: Textual information to provide descriptions and/or additional information.

Text.description: Provides text and indicates whether it is formatted or not.

language.description: The language in which the text is provided.

textFormat.description: Indicates the format of text used in the description e.g. unformatted  or html.

name.description: This will allow you to define the information that is being sent, typically used when multiple occurrences of ParagraphType are being sent.

number.description: The sequence number for the paragraph.

DateTimeStamp.description: Creation date time, Creator ID, last modification date time and last modifier ID for the paragraph.

TimeSpan.description: Specifies the arrival date and departure date which covers the whole Reservation.

start.description: Specifies the start date for the booking as a whole.

end.description: Specifies the end date for the booking as a whole.

URL.description: Web site address, in IETF specified format.

type.description: Defines the purpose of the URL address, such as personal, business, public, etc.

defaultInd.description: Indicates whether or not this is the default URL.

formattedText.description: Provides text and indicates whether it is formatted or not.

language.description: The language in which the text is provided.

textFormat.description: Indicates the format of text used in the description e.g. unformatted  or html.

SocialMedia.description: Specifies social media information used for communication with the traveler.

type.description: Identifies the social media site (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, etc.).

userName.description: Specifies the user name for this specific social media type.

preferredContactInd.description: When true, this social media type is the preferred method for social media communication.

StartWindow.description: The earliest and latest dates acceptable for the start date.

EndWindow.description: The earliest and latest dates acceptable for the end date.

DurationUnit.description: The unit of elapsed time or the day of the week applied to the value.

Code.description: Any code used to specify an item, for example, type of traveler, service code, room amenity, etc.

codeContext.description: Identifies the source authority for the code.

Person_Document_Simple.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

DocType.description: Indicates the type of document (e.g. Passport, Military ID, Drivers License, national ID, Vaccination Certificate). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Document Type (DOC).

Code_OTA.description: Used for codes in the OpenTravel Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 1001, 101.EQP, 1001.EQP or 1001.EQP.X.

ErrorCodes_Enum.description: The ErrorCode  MUST be present and is defined as free-text with a list of recommended enumerated values, to indicate the error type.

ErrorCodes_Enum_Base.description: The ErrorCode  MUST be present and is defined as free-text with a list of recommended enumerated values, to indicate the error type.

ErrorMessage_Enum.description: A textual description to provide more information about the specific error.

ErrorMessage_Enum_Base.description: A textual description to provide more information about the specific error.

severity.description: An optional indicator to reflect the severity of this condition.

docURL.description: If present, this attribute refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

echoToken.description: Implementer: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

timeStamp.description:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock:
20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z

target.description: Test or Production target system indicator.

targetName.description: The name of the Test or Production system.

version.description: The OpenTravel message version indicated by a decimal value.

transactionIdentifier.description: Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

sequenceNmbr.description: Implementer: Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.

transactionStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

correlationID.description: Allows end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

retransmissionIndicatorInd.description: Implementer: It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.

PayloadStdAttributes.description: The standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OpenTravel messages.

echoToken.description: Implementer: A reference for additional message identification, assigned by the requesting host system. When a request message includes an echo token the corresponding response message MUST include an echo token with an identical value.

timeStamp.description:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock:
20 November 2003, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2003-11-20T13:59:38Z

target.description: Test or Production target system indicator.

targetName.description: The name of the Test or Production system.

version.description: The OpenTravel message version indicated by a decimal value.

transactionIdentifier.description: Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).

sequenceNmbr.description: Implementer: Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.

transactionStatusCode.description: This indicates where this message falls within a sequence of messages.

correlationID.description: Allows end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.

retransmissionIndicatorInd.description: Implementer: It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.

language.description: The language in which the error is returned.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Error Codes (ERR).

DocURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordID.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

Position.description: TODO-(use enums and other for lat,long??)Used to specify the geographic coordinates of a location.

latitude.description: The measure of the angular distance on a meridian north or south of the equator.

longitude.description: The measure of the angular distance on a meridian east or west of the prime meridian.

altitude.description: The height of an item, typically above sea level.

altitudeUnitOfMeasureCode.description: Provides the unit of measure for the altitude (e.g., feet, meters, miles, kilometers). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Unit of Measure Code (UOM).

positionAccuracyCode.description: Indicates the accuracy of the property's geo-coding, since the property's longitude and latitude may not always be exact. Refer to OpenTravel Code List Position Accuracy Code (PAC).

RequestorID.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

Identifier.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

RequestorIDDetail.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

messagePassword.description: This password provides an additional level of security that the recipient can use to validate the sending party's authority to use the message.

name.description: The name of the person making the request- may be the travel agent, a traveler on a direct booking, or a third party.

agentSine.description: Identifies the party within the requesting entity.

pseudoCityCode.description: An identification code assigned to an office/agency by a reservation system.

agentDutyCode.description: An authority code assigned to a requestor.

firstDepartPoint.description: TODO-(Code??)The point of first departure in a trip.

eRSP_UserID.description: TODO-(Should this be an Identifier)Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP) assigned identifier used to identify the individual using the ERSP system.

terminalID.description: This is the electronic address of the device from which information is entered.

RequestorID.description: An identifier of the entity making the request (e.g. ATA/IATA/ID number, Electronic Reservation Service Provider (ERSP), Association of British Travel Agents.(ABTA)).

Position.description: Specifies the latitude and longitude of a source.

BookingChannel.description: Specifies the booking channel type and whether it is the primary means of connectivity of the source.

type.description: The type of booking channel (e.g. Global Distribution System (GDS), Alternative Distribution System (ADS), Sales and Catering System (SCS), Property Management System (PMS), Central Reservation System (CRS), Tour Operator System (TOS), Internet and ALL). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Booking Channel Type (BCT).

CompanyName.description: Identifies the company that is associated with the booking channel.

primaryInd.description: Indicates whether the enumerated booking channel is the primary means of connectivity used by the source.

Status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the Status_Enum(NotProcessed | Incomplete | Complete | Unknown) however, the data type is designated an open enumeration, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

name.description: Used to identify the information found in the comment.

language.description: Identifies the language of the comment.

Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

id.description: Provides a unique reference to this contact person.

Identifier.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

maritalStatus_Enum.description: Specifies the marital status of the person.

birthDate.description: The birth date of the person.

Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

Address_Simple.description: When the address is unformatted (FormattedInd="false") these lines will contain free form address details. When the address is formatted and street number and street name must be sent independently, the street number will be sent using StreetNmbr, and the street name will be sent in the first AddressLine occurrence.

Address.description: Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

Number.description: May contain the street number and optionally the street name.

Street.description: May contain the street number when the Street number element is missing.

City.description: City (e.g., Dublin), town, or postal station (i.e., a postal service territory, often used in a military address).

AddressDetail.description: Provides address information. Unformatted addresses are captured using the simple facet.

type.description: Defines the type of address (e.g. home, business, other). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Communication Location Type (CLT).

use.description: Describes the use of the address (e.g. mailing, delivery, billing, etc.). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Address Use Type (AUT).

Remark.description: A remark associated with this address.

examples.value: This address should be used for all official correspondences.

Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of address information between parties.

validInd.description: If true, this is a valid and complete mailing address that has been verified through an address verification service or previously mailed materials have not been returned.

Code_External.description: Code with additional information describing the code authority.

Description.description: Description of who manages this set of codes.

name.description: This may be a source authority/ owner name, ID or code.

uRL.description: Implementer: This is A URL to the code source authority/ owner.

id.description: Implementer: This is used for a database or key ID for the code item (if it is different from the @CodeExtension) in relationship to the obsolete code indicator.

Employee.description: Employment identification; using an employee ID number, title, level within the company, and an indication of their status (e.g., active, retired, on leave, or terminated from employment).  Additional information about an employee can be entered into the element, including the name of the employee, if it differs from the person name identified as a customer or contact.

level.description: Level in employer organization (e.g. seniority) that coveys privileges.

title.description: Title of employee in the employer company that conveys rank or privileges.

description.description: Description of the staff tour code.

employer.description: The airlineThe empoyer to which the EmployeeID is associated.
